Embed Components

Chiron provides embed components for integrating external content into your documentation: YouTube, Twitter, CodePen, and StackBlitz. All embeds are GDPR-compliant with click-to-load functionality and privacy-enhanced modes.

Features

  • ✅ Privacy-First - Click-to-load placeholders, no automatic tracking
  • ✅ GDPR Compliant - Users explicitly consent before loading external content
  • ✅ Responsive Design - Works seamlessly on all devices
  • ✅ Accessibility - Full keyboard navigation and screen reader support
  • ✅ Modern Syntax - Clean JSX-like component syntax
  • ✅ Lazy Loading - Content loads only when user clicks

YouTube Component

Embed YouTube videos with privacy-enhanced mode (youtube-nocookie.com):

Syntax

<YouTube id="VIDEO_ID" />
<YouTube id="VIDEO_ID" aspectRatio="16-9" title="My Video" />
<YouTube id="VIDEO_ID" start="30" autoplay="false" />

Props

Prop Type Required Default Description
id string Yes - YouTube video ID (from the URL)
aspectRatio string No 16-9 Aspect ratio: 16-9, 4-3, 21-9, 1-1
title string No YouTube video Accessibility title for screen readers
start number No 0 Start time in seconds
autoplay boolean No false Auto-play video (not recommended for UX)
class string No - Custom CSS classes

Features

  • Privacy-enhanced domain (youtube-nocookie.com)
  • High-quality thumbnail preview
  • Minimal YouTube branding
  • Related videos from same channel only
  • Custom start times
  • Multiple aspect ratios

Examples

Basic video:

<YouTube id="z_iLzlb7eDc" />

Custom aspect ratio:

<YouTube id="z_iLzlb7eDc" aspectRatio="4-3" />

With start time:

<YouTube id="z_iLzlb7eDc" start="90" title="Tutorial - Skip to Chapter 2" />

Custom styling:

<YouTube id="z_iLzlb7eDc" class="featured-video" />

Twitter Component

Embed tweets with official Twitter widget integration:

Syntax

<Twitter id="TWEET_ID" />
<Twitter id="TWEET_ID" username="handle" theme="dark" />
<Twitter url="https://twitter.com/user/status/ID" />

Props

Prop Type Required Default Description
id string Yes* - Tweet ID (from the URL)
url string Yes* - Full tweet URL (alternative to id)
username string No twitter Username for fallback link
theme string No light Widget theme: light or dark
class string No - Custom CSS classes

*Either id or url is required

Features

  • Official Twitter widget integration
  • Conversation threading
  • Theme support (light/dark)
  • Fallback link to view on Twitter
  • Perfect for testimonials and social proof

Examples

Basic tweet:

<Twitter id="61593468186791936" username="WayneRooney" />

Dark theme:

<Twitter id="61593468186791936" username="WayneRooney" theme="dark" />

With URL:

<Twitter url="https://twitter.com/WayneRooney/status/61593468186791936" />

CodePen Component

Embed interactive code examples from CodePen:

Syntax

<CodePen id="PEN_ID" />
<CodePen id="PEN_ID" user="username" />
<CodePen id="PEN_ID" defaultTab="result" theme="dark" height="500" />

Props

Prop Type Required Default Description
id string Yes - CodePen pen ID (from the URL)
user string No codepen CodePen username
defaultTab string No result Default tab: html, css, js, result
theme string No dark Editor theme: light or dark
height string/number No 400 Embed height in pixels
class string No - Custom CSS classes

Features

  • Live code preview
  • Multiple tab options (HTML, CSS, JS, Result)
  • Theme customization
  • Adjustable height
  • Perfect for tutorials and examples

Examples

Basic pen:

<CodePen id="qEbdVjK" user="soju22" />

Show HTML tab first:

<CodePen id="qEbdVjK" user="soju22" defaultTab="html" />

Light theme with custom height:

<CodePen id="qEbdVjK" user="soju22" theme="light" height="600" />

CSS demo:

<CodePen id="qEbdVjK" user="soju22" defaultTab="css" class="css-demo" />

StackBlitz Component

Embed full development environments with StackBlitz:

Click to load StackBlitz project. This will connect to StackBlitz servers.

View on StackBlitz

Syntax

<StackBlitz id="PROJECT_ID" />
<StackBlitz id="PROJECT_ID" view="preview" />
<StackBlitz id="PROJECT_ID" file="src/App.tsx" height="600" />

Props

Prop Type Required Default Description
id string Yes - StackBlitz project ID
view string No preview Default view: preview, editor, or both
file string No - Open specific file in editor
height string/number No 500 Embed height in pixels
class string No - Custom CSS classes

Features

  • Full IDE with VSCode
  • NPM package installation
  • Terminal access
  • File explorer
  • Framework support (React, Vue, Angular, etc.)
  • Perfect for interactive documentation

Examples

Basic project:

<StackBlitz id="vitejs-vite-xsoiymrw" />

Show editor:

<StackBlitz id="vitejs-vite-xsoiymrw" view="editor" />

Open specific file:

<StackBlitz id="vitejs-vite-xsoiymrw" file="package.json" />

Taller embed:

<StackBlitz id="vitejs-vite-xsoiymrw" height="700" />

Privacy & GDPR Compliance

All embed components follow privacy-first principles:

Click-to-Load

Embeds don't load external content until the user explicitly clicks the placeholder. This:

  • Prevents automatic tracking
  • Reduces page load time
  • Gives users control over their data
  • Complies with GDPR requirements

Privacy Notices

Each embed displays a clear privacy notice explaining what happens when clicked:

"Click to load video. This will connect to YouTube servers (privacy-enhanced mode)."

Privacy-Enhanced Domains

Where available, we use privacy-enhanced domains:

  • YouTube: youtube-nocookie.com instead of youtube.com
  • No automatic cookie setting
  • Minimal tracking until user interaction

User Consent

The click-to-load mechanism serves as explicit user consent to:

  1. Load external resources
  2. Establish connection with third-party servers
  3. Accept cookies from the embed service

Accessibility

All embed components include comprehensive accessibility features:

Keyboard Navigation

  • ✅ Tab - Navigate to embed placeholder
  • ✅ Enter/Space - Activate embed
  • ✅ Tab - Navigate inside loaded embed (when applicable)

Screen Reader Support

  • Descriptive aria-label attributes
  • Clear privacy notices in accessible text
  • Proper role attributes (button for placeholders)
  • Alternative links to view content on source platform

Focus Management

  • Visible focus indicators
  • Logical tab order
  • Focus preservation after activation

Reduced Motion

  • No hover animations
  • No automatic movement
  • User-initiated playback only

Styling

Embed components integrate seamlessly with Chiron's design system:

Default Styles

  • Responsive containers - Maintain aspect ratios on all devices
  • Loading states - Visual feedback during content load
  • Preview images - Thumbnails for better context
  • Privacy badges - Clear visual indicators

Custom Classes

Add custom CSS classes to any embed:

<YouTube id="abc123" class="my-custom-video featured-content" />

Aspect Ratios

YouTube embeds support multiple aspect ratios:

<YouTube id="abc123" aspectRatio="16-9" />  <!-- Widescreen (default) -->
<YouTube id="abc123" aspectRatio="4-3" />   <!-- Classic -->
<YouTube id="abc123" aspectRatio="21-9" />  <!-- Ultra-wide -->
<YouTube id="abc123" aspectRatio="1-1" />   <!-- Square -->

Height Control

CodePen and StackBlitz support custom heights:

<CodePen id="abc123" height="600" />
<StackBlitz id="xyz789" height="700" />

Best Practices

Do's ✅

  • Use descriptive titles - Help users understand content before loading
  • Choose appropriate embeds - Match embed type to content purpose
  • Test keyboard navigation - Ensure all users can activate embeds
  • Provide context - Add text explaining what the embed demonstrates
  • Optimize for mobile - Test responsive behavior on small screens

Don'ts ❌

  • Don't auto-play - Respect user bandwidth and preferences
  • Don't over-embed - Too many embeds slow page load
  • Don't hide important info - Critical content shouldn't require third-party embeds
  • Don't skip privacy notices - Always inform users about data connections
  • Don't nest embeds - Avoid embeds inside expandable sections

When to Use Embeds

Good Use Cases ✅

  • YouTube: Tutorial videos, product demos, conference talks
  • Twitter: Testimonials, announcements, community feedback
  • CodePen: Interactive code examples, CSS demos, UI components
  • StackBlitz: Full project demos, framework examples, live coding

Alternatives ❌

  • Simple code → Use code blocks instead of CodePen
  • Short text → Quote directly instead of Twitter embed
  • Screenshots → Use images instead of video for static demos
  • Local examples → Create in-page demos instead of external embeds

Browser Support

All embed components work on:

  • ✅ Chrome 90+
  • ✅ Firefox 88+
  • ✅ Safari 14+
  • ✅ Edge 90+
  • ✅ Mobile browsers (iOS Safari, Chrome Mobile)

Performance

Embed components are optimized for performance:

  • Lazy loading - No external resources until click
  • Minimal overhead - Small placeholder images only
  • No framework dependencies - Pure JavaScript
  • Progressive enhancement - Fallback links always available

Migration from Old Syntax

If you're using the old shortcode syntax, here's how to migrate:

YouTube

<!-- Old -->
[youtube id="abc123"]
[/youtube]

<!-- New -->
<YouTube id="abc123" />

Twitter

<!-- Old -->
[twitter id="123456"]

<!-- New -->
<Twitter id="123456" />

CodePen

<!-- Old -->
[codepen slug="abc123" user="username"]
[/codepen]

<!-- New -->
<CodePen id="abc123" user="username" />

StackBlitz

<!-- Old -->
[stackblitz id="project-abc123"]
[/stackblitz]

<!-- New -->
<StackBlitz id="project-abc123" />

Technical Details

HTML Structure

Embeds generate semantic HTML with proper ARIA attributes:

<div class="embed-container youtube-embed" 
     data-embed-type="youtube"
     data-embed-src="...">
  <div class="embed-placeholder"
       role="button"
       tabindex="0"
       aria-label="...">
    <!-- Preview content -->
  </div>
</div>

JavaScript Loading

The embed loader script (embed-loader.js) handles:

  • Click event listeners
  • Iframe injection
  • Focus management
  • Loading states

It's automatically included on pages with embeds.

Related Components

  • Button - For call-to-action elements
  • Callout - For highlighting important information
  • Tabs - For organizing multiple embeds

Questions?

If you have questions or need help with embeds:

  1. Check the Getting Started Guide
  2. Review Embeds Demo for live examples
  3. Browse Accessibility Guide
  4. Open an issue on GitHub
